name: antsJointFusion
author: ANTs developers
description:
Advanced Normalization Tools (ANTs) is a C++ library available through the command line that computes high-dimensional mappings to capture the statistics of brain structure and function. It allows one to organize, visualize and statistically explore large biomedical image sets. Additionally, it integrates imaging modalities in space + time and works across species or organ systems with minimal customization.

The ANTs library is considered a state-of-the-art medical image registration and segmentation toolkit which depends on the Insight ToolKit, a widely used medical image processing library to which ANTs developers contribute. ANTs-related tools have also won several international, unbiased competitions such as MICCAI, BRATS, and STACOM.

inputs.name: Image Dimensionality
inputs.description: This option forces the image to be treated as a specified-dimensional image. If not specified, the program tries to infer the dimensionality from the input image.

inputs.name: Target Image
inputs.description: The target image (or multimodal target images) assumed to be aligned to a common image domain.

inputs.name: Atlas Image
inputs.description: The atlas image (or multimodal atlas images) assumed to be aligned to a common image domain.

inputs.name: Atlas Segmentation
inputs.description: The atlas segmentation images. For performing label fusion the number of specified segmentations should be identical to the number of atlas image sets.

inputs.name: Alpha
inputs.description: Regularization term added to matrix Mx for calculating the inverse. Default = 0.1.

inputs.name: Beta
inputs.description: Exponent for mapping intensity difference to the joint error. Default = 2.0.

inputs.name: Patch Radius
inputs.description: Patch radius for similarity measures. Default = 2x2x2.

inputs.name: Patch Metric
inputs.description: Metric to be used in determining the most similar neighborhood patch. Options include Pearson's correlation (PC) and mean squares (MSQ). Default = PC (Pearson correlation).

inputs.name: Search Radius
inputs.description: Search radius for similarity measures. Default = 3x3x3. One can also specify an image where the value at the voxel specifies the isotropic search radius at that voxel.

inputs.name: Exclusion Image
inputs.description: Specify an exclusion region for the given label.

inputs.name: Mask Image
inputs.description: If a mask image is specified, fusion is only performed in the mask region.

inputs.name: Output
inputs.description: The output is the intensity and/or label fusion image. Additional optional outputs include the label posterior probability images and the atlas voting weight images.

output-files.name: Intensity Fusion Image
output-files.description: The output intensity fusion image format.

output-files.name: Label Posterior Probability Image
output-files.description: The output label posterior probability image format.

output-files.name: Atlas Voting Weight Image
output-files.description: The output atlas voting weight image format.
